name: Geomiq
description:
We are Revolutionising Manufacturing with an intelligent platform that provides Instant quotes and Instant ordering of custom manufactured parts, through trusted manufacturing partners.

From rapid tools and moulds, rapid prototypes or large quantity runs of specialist precision parts, our Geomiq Approved partner network lets you innovate faster.

Combined expertise, a data driven software platform and over 1400+ machines on the network ensures your parts are made right first time, every time.

team.name: William Hoyer Millar
team.bioHtml: Founder Network Locum • Worked at @Bloomberg • Studied at @University of Oxford, @University of Leeds

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
About Us 



We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes across and instantly order custom parts. 



We make custom manufacturing really easy! 



We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros , stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems. 



You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business. 



When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 28 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks. 

Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace. 



Who are we looking for? 



We're looking for a talented, and highly-motivated Senior Software Engineer to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our platform to enable us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with taking ownership of [and managing] all aspects of the stack. 



Key Responsibilities 



Drive and develop the technical architecture
Build and own technical direction of the platform
Passionate and curious for development
Somebody who loves to take an idea from concept to production
Shipping high quality products at scale


What technologies are involved? 



Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform. 



Key Requirements 

1.) Thorough knowledge of PHP

2.) Experience with GCP and/or AWS

3.) Experience Building with Microservices Architecture, ideally with Python

4.) Experience with TDD and/or DDD 



Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;



Javascript
WebGL/Three.JS
Docker-Compose
Google Cloud Platform
NGINX
Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering knowledge
CNC machining/Injection Moulding
CAD/CAM software development
Geometric computational analysis
3D Modelling


If you are, 

1. open to an exciting challenge, 

2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and 

3. believe you have what it takes - apply now! 

Full time salary circa £60-75k depending on experience + Share Options 



Benefits 

• Free in-office 3D printing! 

• Weekly snacks & treats 

• An extra day off for your birthday 

• Ability to work from home 

• Competitive pay 

• Generous Holiday 

• A sociable team with weekly office events and lunches

jobs.title: Head of Engineering
jobs.description:
Software Applicants only



About Us 



We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform using AI and ML that enables product designers, engineers and FTSE 100 companies to get instant quotes and instantly order custom parts. 



We make custom manufacturing really easy! 



We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros, stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems. 



You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, being part of an extremely talented team of which their will be the peer to peer learning opportunity, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business. 



When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 28 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks. 

Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace. 



Who are we looking for? 



We're looking for an experienced, talented, and highly-motivated Head of Engineering to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our team and platform, assisting us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with managing a team and sitting with the board of directors.



 Key Responsibilities 



Passion for Building and working with a strong team of engineers
Comfortable with contribution to the hands on aspect 
Proven track record of delivering complex platforms
The ability to use technology to solve complex domain problems


What technologies are involved? 

 

Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform. The platform has a web front end with in browser 3D graphical interface and custom Machine Learning based quoting software on the back end.



Key Requirements 



A wealth of knowledge across multiple technologies
Highly analytical and a keen eye for details
Data driven/quantitive approach for decision making and measuring impact
Believes in coaching engineers to achieve their full potential
Excels under pressure in a fast paced startup
Overseeing a broad set of company deliverables and the ability to wear multiple hats as required in a startup
Responsible for data science, computational geometry, machine learning and AI based projects


Additional experience within any of the below is a bonus;

3D interfaces (WebGL, Three.JS, CAD)
Geometric computational analysis
CAD/CAM software development
Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering knowledge
CNC machining/Injection Moulding


If you are, 

1. open to an exciting challenge, 

2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and 

3. believe you have what it takes - apply now! 



Full time salary circa £60-85k depending on experience + Share Options 



Benefits 

• Free in-office 3D printing! 

• An extra day off for your birthday 

• Ability to work from home 

• Competitive pay 

• Generous Holiday 

• A sociable team with weekly office events 

• We get to work with the most innovative designers every single day!

jobs.title: Sales and Account Manager (Tech) - £25k to £35k + commission incentive
jobs.description:
We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes and instantly order custom parts – a bit like Amazon for custom manufacturing! We already supply customers from Startups to FTSE 100 companies, including parts for space missions!


We make custom manufacturing really easy!


We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on growth, learning and problem solving.


You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business.


When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 22 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks. 
Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace.


Who are we looking for?


We’re looking for a talented, and highly-motivated Sales and Account Manager to join our team. You will also be responsible for quoting and order management. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with taking ownership of [and managing] multiple demands required in a startup.

Key skills; – Ambitious client facing sales/account manager – Exceptional communication skills


Experience; – B2B or B2C Sales experience – Commercial knowledge and understanding of outbound sales – Sales brokering – Upsell through account management – Effectively using CRM systems


- Technical background helpful although not essential

Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;
• Sales and account management
• Technical/Maths/Engineering background


If you are, 
1. open to an exciting challenge, 
2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and 
3. believe you have what it takes – apply now!


Full time salary circa £25-35k depending on experience + Commission incentive


Benefits 
• Free in-office 3D printing! 
• Tasty snacks & treats 
• An extra day off for your birthday 
• Competitive pay 
• Generous Holiday 
• A sociable team with weekly office events 
• Prime location in Silicon Roundabout 
• We get to work with the most innovative designers and companies every single day!

jobs.title: Senior Laravel Developer
jobs.description:
About Us 

We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform that enables product designers and engineers to get instant quotes across and instantly order custom parts. 

We make custom manufacturing really easy! 

We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros , stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems. 

You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business. 

When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 25 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks. 
Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace. 

Who are we looking for? 

We're looking for a talented, and highly-motivated Senior Laravel Developer to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our platform to enable us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with taking ownership of [and managing] all aspects of the stack. 

Key Responsibilities 

• Passion and proven track record of shipping high quality web and software based projects 
• Ownership of projects, issues and their resolution 
• Communication of ideas, planning and progress to the rest of the team 

What technologies are involved? 

Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform. 

Key Requirements 
1.) Thorough knowledge of Laravel, JavaScript, PHP 
2.) Ideally experience of C++, Python Vue.JS
3.) Experience Building with Microservices Architecture 
4.) Experience with TDD and/or DDD 
Additional Desirable Experience within any of the below;
•	NGINX
•	WebGL/Three.JS/Java
•	Docker/Docker Compose 
•	Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering knowledge
•	CNC machining/Injection Moulding 
•	CAD/CAM software development
•	Geometric computational analysis
•	3D Modelling 

If you are, 
1. open to an exciting challenge, 
2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and 
3. believe you have what it takes - apply now! 
Full time salary circa £40-65k depending on experience + Share Options 

Benefits 
• Free in-office 3D printing! 
• Weekly snacks & treats 
• An extra day off for your birthday 
• Ability to work from home 
• Competitive pay 
• Generous Holiday 
• A sociable team with weekly office events 
• Prime location in Silicon Roundabout 
• We get to work with the most innovative designers every single day!
